Jackson will be joined by Aerosmith's Steven Tyler and singer Jennifer Lopez when the show returns next week, after Simon Cowell , Ellen DeGeneres , and Kara DioGuardi decided not to return for this year's series. Simon Cowell is irreplaceable, but people will be surprised to see that I'm very assertive this season, Jackson told PopEater, admitting that contestants have already dubbed him this year's meanest judge. The producer also revealed that the new judging panel have already had disagreements over which contestants to put through.

Three years, that seems like such a long time," said John Garcia, a manager of the dog operation at Best Friends, who has done extensive work with the Michael Vick pit bulls. place on April 4, has been under discussion for a while, said Eric Schmidt . "As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated," he explained in a Google blog post Thursday. So Larry, Sergey and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making-- and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured. Eric Schmidt , who is one of Silicon Valley's best-known corporate leaders, will eventually assume the role of Executive Chairman, serving as an advisor to Page and co-founder Brin. Simon Cowell writes I look upon it[ groveling] as a sign of desperation. So many times people come in and they come up with this terrible dialogue about how much they like me or Randy or Paula. It's demeaning, and there's no point to it. We're not looking for a nice person; we're looking for somebody who's confident and assured, but talented above all. Trust me-- most stars aren't nice. 2. to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time. By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company," Eric Schmidt explains. Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come. While Larry Page manages Google's day-to-day operations, co-founder Sergey Brin will work on new products and strategic projects.
